Class Rule

java.lang.Object
Rule
Direct Known Subclasses:
ElementaryRule, TotalisticRule
public abstract class Rule extends Object
This class represents any one of the 256 possible rules that govern the evolution of ECAs.
Author:
Mounir Zahidi // collab with Nick Rodriguez

  • Method Details

    • getRuleNum

      public int getRuleNum()
      Return the rule's Wolfram code.
      Returns:
      the rule in wolfram's code

    • getNeighborhood

      public abstract boolean[] getNeighborhood​(int index, Generation gen)
      Parameters:
      index - index of the cell in the generation
      gen - the generation containing the cell states
      Returns:
      the state of the cell with the given index in the given Generation along with the states of its two nearest neighbors.

    • evolve

      public abstract boolean evolve​(boolean[] neighborhood)
      Return the next state of a cell with the given neighborhood of states. The input is an array that contains the states of the left neighbor, the cell itself, and the right neighbor (in that order).
      Parameters:
      neighborhood - the boolean array[] representing the neighborhood of the cell in question.
      Returns:
      the state of the cell according to the wolfram code rule

    • evolve

      public Generation evolve​(Generation gen)
      Apply the rule to the given Generation and return the next Generation.
      Parameters:
      gen - the generation to evolve
      Returns:
      the evolved generation

    • ruleIntArray

      public int[] ruleIntArray()
      Returns:
      returns the rule in wolfram code in an array.

    • ruleTableString

      public abstract String ruleTableString​(char falseSymbol, char trueSymbol)
      Parameters:
      falseSymbol - the char Symbol representing the true value.
      trueSymbol - the char symbol representing the false value.
      Returns:
      A string representation of the table depicts the rule using the given characters to represent false and true.

    • getNeighborhoodByRadius

      public static boolean[] getNeighborhoodByRadius​(int idx, int radius, Generation gen)
      Parameters:
      idx - the index of the cell in question
      radius - the number of the neighborhoods to take from each side
      gen - the generation in question
      Returns:
      he cell states in the neighborhood of the cell with the given index and specified radius.
